body.p:
Enclosed please find
seven dollars 37 cts amount of 4 (larger
size) prayer books sent less Express
charges as per a/c enclosed. I hope to
sell the small ones soon but would not
wait to remit you, although the books
are not yet paid for. I send by Express
because the post is not safe. I once
remitted to Moss & Bro. In your city a small
amount which went where perhaps you
and Mr Newhouses new ? are. Mrs
Cohen sent a dollar in a letter to Sarah
Joseph a couple of weeks since, that also
has been geganavd? as a worthy Bar
Tismel here is accustomed to say. It will
cost you little more than post charges.

It trust you have by this
time received the copy of my father's
work on the “Melodies” which was ordered
to be sent you from New York. The London
press musical & literary critics have
spoken in the highest terms of the books
and pronounced the melodies incomparably
solemn. Many of these melodies have

been introduced into the German synagogues
of London since the publication of
the book. I have yet received no
orders as to advertising it in the U. S.
Jewish papers; but when you again
will, please let me what a square of
10 or 12 lines will cost for one year.
I regret that only a few copies have
as yet arrived, and as many as I could
spare have gone to Editors—yours among
them sent from New York; but I need
not add I shall be much pleased to
receive subscribers names from you
until you can be supplied; or if you
will send me the names I may be able
to send the books. The work has been
very successful indeed in England, and
as they possess the plates I hope that
if they meet with due encouragement
they will issue the book at a cheaper
rate, and also a volume of the chants
which are equally fine. Please bring
the book prominently before your reader
It deserves honorable mention.

Sarah Joseph desires me to
inform you that a copy of the Occident

is left for her regularly at Mrs Cohens
in Philada—so Mrs Cohen writes her.
Now as she receives one from me—you
yourself having directed it on some
occasions, there must be a mistake
here, which you will no doubt rectify.

As far as I have been able to learn
I regret to say our few who buy prayer
books here are not likely to ?
the publication of the Hebrew Edition of prayers
you propose. If those who pay $10 for a
set of Hebrew are a class who would sooner
pay 8 more & have a set of Hebrew & English
—while those who buy all Hebrew prefer
those famous 5 dollar sets Feyertags
Gibethe den Sphaidim? published “Bey
Auton Edlen vore Sch? (may his shadow
never be less—even if his paper & print be
better.) This ever living house has issued
more than one sugar paper edition of
prayers with (such!) spanish or
rather Shponish. I once thought it
would do to print Hebrew daily prayers and
spoke to you about it. But Bush's
?, and a very nice little one
printed in Amsterdam which Hazan
Lyons showd me when in New York

costing 25 cents put me out of ?
with such a notion.

There is nothing stirring here
worth writing about. I hope your
synagogue gives a head and proves
that there is plenty of room for
two or even three for the Portuguese
Minhag in these days of Minhag
America
